Pretty good control of the centre for white.
Is this OK? I don't play Nf6 right away in case White does Ng5.
I understand that white was trying to prevent Bg4, but this seems like a bit of a wasted move.
I decided that I should just develop my knight, even if it does allow Ng5.
As expected.
I didn't want to block any of my bishops with my queen to defend f7, but 6. Bxe6 fxe6 seems like it weakens my kingside a bit.
Threatening to double my pawns.
I decide to threaten the bishop, because Bxc6 opens up the b-file for my rook.
I now have an open file and good control of the centre.
